title: PaperPort SE14 crashes during Save or Save As - but only when Firefox is running!
content: Just after the last update (131.0.2), PaperPort SE 14 has been crashing whenever I attempt a Save or Save As operation, either on new scan or previous scan. This happens ONLY when Firefox is running. (Doesn't matter what site or URL and also occurs during Troubleshoot Mode.) If I close Firefox, the operation(s) are successful, just as they have been for many, many years. (Nuance stopped supporting PaperPort around 2015). I also do not have any problems when I use a different browser (Edge or Chrome). There was also a Windows update on the same day as Firefox was updated but that seems irrelevant since the crashes do not occur under other browsers. Also, it doesn't seem to be in the "main' program PaperPort, but more so in "ImageView" which is used to edit or modify a new or existing scan. All operations from the main program, including Save & Save As, operate normally so it doesn't seem related to file permissions, etc. And why would there be problems only when Firefox is running?

title: Passwords that aren't mine
content:
Hi

I was just scrolling through passwords on my Firefox password manager and found 2 passwords that didn't belong to me I deleted them but am now concerned as to how they got there. One was for 'piano vx' (https://auth.piano.io/u/login identifierstate=hKFo2SAwOXdxTTVPWVcxU0tOc25oUWVWWTNnMTBHRFRiY2NCRaFur3VuaXZlcnNhbC1sb2dpbqN0aWTZIF9YUG5IRDNmaTFLRnJSd0hlTHpTNE9jWmJ3YzZucEE0o2NpZNkgTmJJZVZxMkJ6ZkpzSjlQR1RxZTdqTmRxeVRvaGUyWjQ) I have scrolled down through my Firefox history and the only 'Piano vx' entries are from today when I was checking what the password was for. I have never visited that site before so could not have saved a password.

I cannot remember the other spurious one I deleted (as have had a general tidy up whilst I was there) but it gave my user name as 'scottish' which is something I would not use as I am not!

Can anyone shed any light on how these passwords which have not been generated by me are showing in my Firefox password manager please? I have run Microsoft Defender and Eset but neither showing any issues.

I have changed my Firefox password.

Many thanks Gill

title: Can't open PG&E, and some web sites ftom Firefox. It says browser is not compatible.
content:
am wondering if you could help in a matter with Firefox, since seems to beg Firefox access problem, apparently due to a new feature in Firefox? I was told to change the policy settings in Firegox about config to show false, which I did. I attached a picture of the pop up I get when I open Firefox, which opens to 

Yahoo.com, news feed

It has to do with not being able to access Firefox, when I try to open PG&E, (Pacific Gas & Electric Company), as I usually do. I have searched and found that this is apparently a Firefox issue that is being caused by a new feature being utilized in Firefox. It appears that the issue is NOT a PG&E's problem, but some program in Firefox not being compatible with something in PG&E website. Also with this issue, I can't view videos in the news stories, because of thr privacy pop up, it says to allow advertising, which I don't select, since I have gone into Firefox settings and set the it to don't srll my info. And, btw, I was getting the pop up BEFORE I I changed the don't sell settings in Firefox. I have to copy the URL and paste it into Chrome to see the vidros in the news stories. Is there a work around in Firefox that can be used to access PG&E with Firefox, as I have read in a few forums that we need to ‘allow' Firefox from the PG&E web site, but that can't be done if we can't open it in the browser? Not sure if that info is accurate though. Why would Firefox be using a feature that doesn't allow all web sites, if that is the actual cause? Thank you for your help, and hopefully there is a solution to fix this particular issue. Stay safe and well. Mike S

title: Per molti siti (tipo Whatsapp web, DeePL, Google, ecc) devo fare ogni volta il login.
content: Gentile supporto Mozilla, ho dovuto reinstallare il mio PC con Linux Mint. Quando ho aperto Firefox, ho fatto il login al mio account ed ho fatto la sincronizzazione. Quando visito molti siti, però, mi chiede ogni volta di fare il login (tra i quali, come detto nell'Oggetto, Whatsapp web, DeePL, Google, e molti altri). Avevo provato a riattivare l'estensione Firefox Multi-Account Containers (che avevo disattivato molto tempo fa perché mi dava problemi) ma, dopo averla testata, l'ho di nuovo disattivata. Dico questo perché forse dipende proprio da questo, in quanto i vari siti che mi danno quel problema, quando l'estensione era attivata, si trovavano in diversi contenitori. Grazie e cordiali saluti, Francesco

title: Constantly signed out of various websites, requiring verification everytime despite all the changes with history and cookies
content:
Hi, I had the idea to try Opera browser as I saw various videos about it. Firefox does slow me down at times even though it's what I have used for years.

Soon after, I defaulted back to using Firefox but the settings must have gotten changed. Everytime I wish to log in to any site, I have to type in my email again. The passwords usually are the old ones that show up.

With Amazon for instance. I must sign in and verify with codes sent to my mobile few times a day. I have searched for help online and gone through the cookies and history and privacy settings, turn this on or that off, don't do this and don't do that. Despite all that, the sites don't remember my email logins. If I go from voucher code to another site, it doesn't remember my credentials, so I don't get the deal or voucher. Amazon on my mobile works perfect but on my laptop, it's just a nightmare to have to sign in and verify each time. Outlook refuses to recognize my password most times and so it goes on.

If I cannot fix this asap, I will then have to remove Firefox as a browser altogether and find anything else that works! Please advise. Last time I reached out to Firefox, I never heard back! Fingers Crossed x

sharad
creator: sharad1

title: Dropdown menus in Cyrillic not displaying correct characters when expanded
content:
If I visit this site (in Bulgarian, so in Cyrillic alphabet, UTF8 encoding): https://shop.ilex.bg/index.php?route=product/product&path=17_42&product_id=102

and expand the dropdown menu on the right, the menu items are displayed in gibberish, not in Bulgarian.

Even if they are in Bulgarian when you view source / inspect the <select> in the code. And the currently selected item is displayed as it should as well.

That happens on a number of other sites (another example: https://crash.bg/kompyutri-vtora-raka), but not every site I visit. The problem is present in FF only, Chrome / Edge do not have this problem.

What's even more weird is that if copy the HTML code (the whole <select>) into a personal page on my own site which runs on wordpress, the contents of <select> show as they should.

I have an account on a website I visit near-daily. Despite having both cookies for this website persist and the password supposedly saved, the last three times I've visited the website I've been logged out and the password is nowhere to be found. Having to switch between my password manager and browser is annoying beyond description.

(That's actually not true. I have quite a few choice descriptors for this program, but have chosen to omit them)

Displays a shortcut to prompts when you select text. Firefox sends the text, page title, and prompt to the chatbot." is always checked and greyed out.

title: New tab and downloads buttons keep relocating to the right side of the tabs bar when opening Firefox
content:
Hello,

Every time I close and reopen Firefox, the new tab and downloads buttons relocate to the far left of the tabs bar. This can be fixed temporarily by customizing the toolbar but the icons move back when Firefox is closed and reloaded.

Prior to this issue, I had installed a custom theme by Mozilla and have since removed it, but this hasn't fixed the issue.

Additionally, I was watching a YouTube video in full screen mode and, when I left full screen mode, all of my bookmarks, the home button, the new tab, downloads, and nearly every other button in the area were gone. I was able to fix this by customizing the toolbar, but ever since then, the new tab and downloads buttons have migrated. The video I was watching was fairly long so I'm not sure what caused the mass exodus of buttons or exactly when it happened.

Is there anyway to make the buttons stay put?

Thank you.
creator: florsolitaire
